section.title: Using processing instructions
section.para: Processing instructions of the form <?eval EXPRESSION?> used in the DocBook documents are replaced with the result of evaluation of the EXPRESSION, for example: Version .
Processing instructions can only be used inside XML elements, not in attributes.

section.title: Using entity substitutions
section.para: This sample shows the use of entity substitution defined in your pom.xml configuration: &version; = &version;. The entity substitution is also working within xml attributes as you can see in the following link: this is a link.

To enable this functionality, you need to add a Docbook DOCTYPE declaration to you top-level DocBook file, even though DocBook 5.x doesn't really have a DTD :). Between the XML declaration and the root element, add the following: <!DOCTYPE article PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DocBook XML V5.0//EN" "http://www.oasis-open.org/docbook/xml/5.0/dtd/docbook.dtd"> If using root element other than "article", adjust DOCTYPE declaration accordingly.
